elements.title: James McDivitt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that astronaut James McDivitt (pictured) saw a UFO during his first spaceflight?

elements.title: Racism-Turanism trials (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the defendants in the Racism-Turanism trials between 1944 and 1947 were absolved because racism wasn't contrary to the Turkish constitution?

elements.title: Bob Zellner (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that civil rights activist Bob Zellner was arrested at least 25 times and severely beaten on several occasions for his activism?

elements.title: his sculpture of her (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Queen Elizabeth II sat for Ben Enwonwu on twelve occasions as he created his sculpture of her?

elements.title: Jail (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jay-Z was re-added to "Jail" by Kanye West after initially being replaced with DaBaby?

elements.title: Jan Hecker (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jan Hecker influenced the foreign policy of Angela Merkel?

elements.title: World Bodybuilding Federation (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1992 championship of Vince McMahon's World Bodybuilding Federation consisted of "two of the silliest hours in the history of live sports"?

elements.title: Why (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that "why" is the only lyric of "Why"?
